image.altText: A woman with brown curly hair stands on a ladder to get a view of the level of a water tank.

props.synopsis: As summer approaches, volunteer fire fighter Suzie Gifford shares her bushfire plan, how she prepares her home against an ember attack, and what's in her emergency kit.

title.children: This bushfire season should you stay or go? This firefighter has some advice for that

image.altText: A hand holding a phone displaying a map

props.synopsis: Since the start of the Gaza war, Israel has been deploying a tactic known as GPS "spoofing", which is designed to fool enemy missiles but has also had detrimental impacts on civilian life.

title.children: In the Middle East, dating apps, food delivery and map navigation are leading everyone to Beirut Airport

image.altText: Phillip Mehrtens sitting in a chair after being freed. He has long hair and a beard.

props.synopsis: Armed pro-independence rebels in Indonesia's Papua region have released New Zealand man Philip Mehrtens after holding him hostage for more than 19 months.

title.children: NZ pilot freed after being held hostage by armed rebels in Indonesia's Papua region for 19 months

image.altText: A person looks inside a building with rubble strewn throughout it

props.synopsis: It comes as the Lebanese health ministry raises the death toll from an Israeli strike on Beirut's suburbs to at least 37, including three children and seven women.

title.children: Gaza officials say at least 22 people killed in Israeli strike on school

image.altText: Saline 1

props.synopsis: One senior clinician at a major Sydney hospital has described the ongoing situation as "a complete sh**show".

title.children: 'You're being asked to act as a gatekeeper': Doctors say they are still being forced to conserve IV fluids

image.altText: A woman with a neutral expression looks at the camera. In the background, medical equipment is visible.

props.synopsis: Sholbaana Kuular and her family have firsthand experience with regard to how racist Russian society can be, but a proposed new law that would limit the number of migrant children in classrooms has outlined how discrimination often starts at state level.

title.children: Inside the 'horrible machine' of Russian racism, where bullying starts at state level

image.altText: A baby receiving a vaccination while being held by his mother

props.synopsis: Health authorities are urging at-risk Tasmanians to get vaccinated against the highly infectious illness, as the state prepares for a 12 to 18-month whooping cough wave.

title.children: Tasmania in early stage of whooping cough epidemic as authorities urge vulnerable to vaccinate

image.altText: The Premier, Health Minister, and candidate and a youth worker stand in a line and smile outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: The Liberals promised $120 million over five years for a new cardiac centre for the state's north at the Launceston General Hospital, but last week's state budget revealed no funding allocation for the project.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals blasted after 'priority' Northern Heart Centre election promise not funded in state budget

image.altText: Western Lakes

props.synopsis: For almost a decade, a debate has raged in Tasmania over a tourism proposal inside a national park. It's faced court appeals, community campaigns, and now, a liquidation order.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ It was meant to fly high-paying guests to a remote island in Tasmania's wilderness. Now the company is in liquidation

image.altText: A drone shot of a 3D printed neighbourhood in Texas

props.synopsis: Texas just opened its biggest 3D-printed neighbourhood as a solution to its acute housing problem. Could it be the solution the Australian construction has been waiting for?

title.children: A four-tonne machine just printed a house in the US. What can Australia learn?

image.altText: a group of men look at a BYD car in front of a BYD logo

props.synopsis: Despite tariffs and a slowing global demand for electric vehicles in recent months, China is steaming ahead with its transition to EVs.

title.children: 'The Chinese offensive is visible everywhere': The changing face of the auto industry

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch helped out of the back seat of a car by his wife and a security guard

props.synopsis: If the latest instalment in the Murdoch family saga tells us anything, it is that while the patriarch no longer jokes about immortality, he's at least retained his dark sense of humour.

title.children: War of the words breaks out over Rupert's desperate bid to control beyond the grave

image.altText: A vintage-style illustration of two boxers fighting in a ring, surrounded by a crowd

props.synopsis: The past 12 years have delivered a spectacular meteor shower of defamation cases brought by celebrities, politicians and businessfolk, and fought out on the national stage of the Federal Court. ABC Long Reads has the story of how it all began.Â

title.children: The multi-million-dollar celebrity court cases that sometimes have a nasty habit of backfiring

image.altText: Scott Barrett holds up the Bledisloe Cup.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies launch a late comeback but it is to no avail, as the All Blacks triumph 31-28 following a pulsating climax to the opening Bledisloe Cup Test in Sydney.

title.children: All Blacks retain Bledisloe Cup after holding off fast-finishing Wallabies

image.altText: A man and woman hug next to police tape at Daylesford after a fatal crash.

props.synopsis: Five people died when the car of diabetic William Swale crashed into an outdoor eating area when he had a hypoglycaemic episode.Â

title.children: Daylesford pub crash driver William Swale's 'hypo' led to all charges being dropped. So what is a 'hypo'?

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: A report reveals numerous "deficiencies" in the security preparations ahead of Trump's attempted assassination, in the most formal attempt by the Secret Service to catalogue its errors of the day.

title.children: Secret Service report details litany of communication failures preceding July assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: People are seen carrying umbrellas as rain falls in Sydney

props.synopsis: A near-nationwide soaking will drench every Australian state and territory this week, including potential record heavy falls in the north-west tropics.

title.children: Rare September soaking for all Australian states this week could break rain records and signal wet spring and summer

image.altText: A photo of Travis King in army uniform, standing in front of an American flag. He is a black man  in his 20s with dark eyes.

props.synopsis: With time already served and credit for good behaviour, the US Army soldier was released, his lawyer says.

title.children: US soldier who fled to North Korea now free after pleading guilty to desertion

image.altText: Suzanne Armstrong and Susan Bartlett were housemates in Collingwood in 1977.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested in Italy over the notorious alleged murder of two housemates in inner-city Melbourne almost half a century ago.

title.children: Man arrested in Rome almost 50 years after infamous Easey Street deaths in Melbourne's Collingwood

image.altText: People gather on a beach as a plume of smoke bellows

props.synopsis: A fire burning near Oxford Falls in Sydney's north that was considered out of control earlier today has been downgraded from Emergency to Advice.

title.children: Blaze in Sydney's north downgraded from Emergency level

image.altText: A man with his face blurred, being approached by four immigration officials.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police allege the 62-year-old man was facing sexual offences but failed to appear in a Brisbane court in 2021.

title.children: Man charged with historical sexual offences extradited to Queensland after being deported from Thailand

image.altText: Raelene poses with a black dress

props.synopsis: Pensioner Raelene Cowan has little money left over after buying food and paying the bills. But she still treats herself to a new outfit, with the help of Thread Together, a program that's saving unwanted clothing destined for landfill.Â

title.children: 'Everyone deserves to feel good': New clothes diverted from landfill to people in need amid cost of living crisis

image.altText: Amanda Stoker looks to her side while attending a parliamentary committee

props.synopsis: An LNP candidate has withdrawn her support for a rabbi who repeatedly compared homosexuality to paedophilia, bestiality, and incest.

title.children: LNP candidate pleads ignorance after pulling support for rabbi with 'extreme' anti-homosexual views

image.altText: A young mother and child playing inside a house

props.synopsis: Parenting programs are available throughout the country, but experts say a lack of awareness, societal expectations and stigmas might be stopping more people from signing up.Â

title.children: Many people do prenatal courses, but not parenting ones. Experts say this needs to change

image.altText: 2008-01-16T120000Z_1761576427_GM1DXBBLHZAA_RTRMADP_3_BRITAIN-DIANA

props.synopsis: The lawyers representing the women say the case was akin to the crimes of sex offenders Jimmy Savile, Jeffery Epstein and Harvey Weinstein.

title.children: Lawyers of multiple women who accused former Harrods owner Mohamed Al Fayed of rape say he was a 'monster'

image.altText: A woman holding a trans-Pride flag, stands and smiles in front of Newcastle City Hall

props.synopsis: Paige Johnson says affirming her gender gave her the confidence to advocate for her community â€” on everything from better roads to equal rights.

title.children: An engineer hoping to inspire, Paige Johnson becomes Newcastle's first transgender politician

image.altText: Three young women walk down a set of stairs surrounded by fluorescent lights in Macau

props.synopsis: Macau has long been a gambler's paradise but has its luck run out?

title.children: Macau bet big on the gambling industry. And then its luck ran out

image.altText: David Anderson answers questions while facing a senate hearing

props.synopsis: The ABC's managing director David Anderson has announced there will be an independent review into a 2022 story that included an "editing error in the audio" of helmet cam footage captured by commandos.

title.children: ABC announces independent review into story that featured 'editing error' in helmet cam footage of commandos

image.altText: A girl stands in the church during a wedding ceremony in the Philippines

props.synopsis: Most married Filipinos cannot legally end their marriage in the Catholic-majority country. A new bill looks set to change that.

title.children: Why the Philippines is the only country outside the Vatican where divorce is illegal

image.altText: Black and white picture of a man wearing a bow tie and suit jacket sitting in a car, waving at the crowds

props.synopsis: These US musicians were recruited as 'jazz ambassadors'. Unbeknownst to them, some played a role in a coup in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in 1961. Â

title.children: Louis Armstrong was sent to the Congo as a jazz ambassador. His concert was used as cover for a coup

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Heavily redacted government briefing documents made public reveal ASIO checked all Palestinian visa holders in March, with "no adverse information identified".

title.children: ASIO referred every Palestinian visa holder, testing Coalition's claims of lax screening

image.altText: Steven King speaks to Cats players during a 2024 AFL match.

props.synopsis: Geelong assistant coach Steven King has been given the all-clear by doctors after collapsing during a training session ahead of Saturday's clash against Brisbane.

title.children: 'Quite confronting': Cats assistant coach discharged from hospital after collapsing at training ahead of prelim final

image.altText: A father holds his son while both smile. The mother watches on outside the family's home.

props.synopsis: About 1,300 Palestinians with approved visas have resettled in Australia since October when Israel invaded the Gaza Strip. The Gharbias are among those families who have moved here and are attempting to rebuild their lives.

title.children: Young student Mousa 'lost everything' in Gaza, but is finding his feet in a Sydney primary school

image.altText: Drone images taken of native bush land showing dead patches with a few green trees.

props.synopsis: Only a small fraction of eucalyptus woodland remains alive in this region of Western Australia and the habitat loss is threatening wildlife and plant survival.Â

title.children: Hot, dry conditions kill masses of native vegetation in WA's Wheatbelt
